name: I'm looking at buying the EE Bundle on Steam - how high can I level on their mods?
author: Theophilus Fist

posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
New Laptop and I do not feel like downloading Gog and playing my paid for Diamond Edition.

If I get EE on Steam, there's an option to get a bundle with:
  • Neverwinter Nights: Enhanced Edition - The entire Neverwinter Nights adventure, the Shadows of Undrentide & Hordes of the Underdark expansions, three premium modules (Kingmaker, ShadowGuard, and Witch’s Wake), the Dungeon Master Client, and the Aurora Toolset.
  • Neverwinter Nights: Tyrants of the Moonsea - 
  • Neverwinter Nights: Pirates of the Sword Coast - 
  • Neverwinter Nights: Wyvern Crown of Cormyr - Explore the kingdom on horseback, compete in jousting tournaments, and become a knight of Cormyr!
  • Neverwinter Nights: Infinite Dungeons - 
  • Neverwinter Nights: Darkness over Daggerford - 
  • Neverwinter Nights: Heroes of Neverwinter - 
  • Neverwinter Nights: Dark Dreams of Furiae - 
I've played POTSC and didn't like WCoC.  With the other modules:

A) Can I play any of them after HOTU (do they level scale)?
B) How high can one level in any of them?

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
Hey Theo,

The only one you could play after HOTU is Infinite Dungeons which imho isn't worth it.

I think Heroes of NW is just a portrait pack. You can put better portraits into your game by adding them manually for free.

Darkness Over Daggerford and Tyrants of the Moonsea are totally worth playing; I really enjoyed them. I can't remember exactly how high you can level but I think it's around 16-17 for DOD and around 20 for TOTMS.

I started DDoF but I couldn't really get into it.

If you want to level up higher there are lots of player-made modules that are outstanding. Check out the ones discussed in this section of the forum. Alternatively, you could check Lilura's comprehensive list of modules.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I highly recommend Infinite Dungeons for those who like just doing the dungeon thing (I found it fun) - the boss fights are refreshingly interesting imo.

I also like the socket system - YMMV
